Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
It's taking:
--- 12.7620718479 seconds ---
On CCNG chain with just 56 oracles on chain for this https://github.com/tonymorony/trollbox_gui/blob/master/chatlib.py#L4 one execution (getting list of all oracles, then for each oracle checking oraclesinfo and checking if description starting from CHAT to recognise it as a room)

Any suggestions how to improve speed are highly appreciated. If it's possible to speedup it somehow I'll update it in background same as messages, just a little bit more rare.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: As an option I think to save oracleslist to file on first execution

Author: dukeleto#7326

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: lol

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We have a few things started, but wont have all info for at least a few more days yet

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
1) Staked Notary - close to automatic notary node system adds chains on the fly and handles multiple brnachs for multiple AC's 
2) trollbox - on chain chat dAPP in python using oracles CC
3) Staked Dog- GPS tracker on a dog logging to the blockchain, secured by dpow
4) Streamer - ondemand chains with extreme bandwith to save files into/ stream video etc
5) MoMoM cluster testing - allows multiple chains to share coins.

Author: emma#2653
Content: any doc on stakedchain..what is stakedchain?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: staked chain is not exactly defined right now ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its a chain, that has as many other chains as we want

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can send coins between this group of chains

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The main chain allows a stable to place to mine/stake while the other chains are some what disposable for testing Crypto Condition contracts and other things

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: We have been testing Komodo CC contracts and developing on them and the platform in general.

Author: emma#2653
Content: a chain with multiple side chains

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes as amazing as that sounds

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You can send coins from one blockchain to another

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: The STAKED chain is the main chain in the cluster, and other clusters or individual chains can be added.  The main STAKED chain notarizes all of the others to KMD and therefore BTC.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: It's not quite as simple as a chain with sidechains due the CC aspect.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: As Blackjok3r says, migration of coins between separate chains is possible.  It is just one of the CCs that we are testing.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: The power of these CCs will make this very different than the simple chain/assetchain model that was the previous norn.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: STAKED is also able to test CCs for others.  And when the main STAKED chain is live others will be able to join the STAKED clusters for testing or other purposes.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: As Blackjok3r also mentioned the exact definition of STAKED is still in development stages.  So of course things will inevitably change to some degree or other!

Author: emma#2653
Content: general question - how someone's career will be safeguarded by learning to build blockchains on kmd platform? what kind of opportunities are there now and for future?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Recently Komodo has made it extremely easy to start your own chain on the platform.  Almost anyone can do that.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: The technology that Komodo is developing, and we are testing in STAKED, is right on the cutting edge of so many areas. Not many places you can participate that and probably none that have it in one place.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: What I have managed to learn here in a single year, would have taken we 5-6 years at a univeristy, for sure.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: I'm not the person to give career advice so I won't touch that, haha.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You cant even do courses on most of this stuff

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: job prospects, not sure ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But create something cool enough and you wont have to work a "job" again
